Remember, if you find anything that looks even slightly mechanical down in those Foundries, bring it to me and I'll see if I can make it into a little statue for you.
I'm afraid I'm all out of spare parts at the moment! I'm waiting on another shipment--if you come back a week from now, I'm sure I can work on your items for you then.

With a sudden gasp, the Arcanum Tinker looks up from the trophy you just handed him and peers into your face. He is suddenly intoxicated with  paroxyms of joy at the sight of you; if he were not such a hardy soul, he would lose conciousness.
YES! It is %s!  Back from the wars, I see, and you've proven yourself a mighty champion, no less! I shall fashion this into a trophy worthy of your stature!
The Tinker sets about his work, then turns to you when he is finished.

This unique statue is for you, to commemorate your valor for destroying the Statues threatening the fair cities of Holtburg, Yaraq, and Shoushi. Please accept it with the thanks and  gratitude of all  the citizens of New Aluvia. The townsfolk of Dereth are forever in your debt.
Hooray for %s!

A gear from one of those Bronze Drudge statues! Wait--somehow it doesn't look the same as the ones everyone was bringing me last month! Well, let's give it a try anyway, shall we?
Chattering excitedly, the tinker upends his worksack and starts rummaging through its contents.
Gears, pliers, metal plates, screws, nuts and bolts,  A-ha! Here we go...
The tinker swiftly snaps the gear into an  assemblage of his spare parts and turns to you in surprise.
A mini-statue--but look! Green, just like the statues in town. Guess those statues are getting weaker all the time. Keep up the good work!
HouseStatueDrudgeGiven

The Arcanum Tinker squints at you and quickly sizes you up.

No, that wasn't YOUR name I heard singing from the hills! You're not the one who killed the Native Cast in the towns' defense! Why don't you give this trophy to the one who truly destroyed the statue? There's a good fellow.
